s1: This course provides basic approaches for designing and analysing algorithms and data structures.
s2: The course also treats intellectual property considerations in software development and deployment.

s1: It will focus on two fundamental problems in computing: Sorting and searching.
s2: Apply fundamental programming concepts for medium scale programs.

s1: It will cover various data structures and algorithm design techniques for solving these two classes of problems, as well as basic performance measures and analysis techniques for solving such problems.
s2: Use, implement, and evaluate more advanced data structures and associated algorithms; discuss factors other than computational efficiency for evaluating software; create, implement, debug, and evaluate algorithms for solving problems, including recursively, using divide-and-conquer, and via decomposition; implement an abstract data type; analyse design and implementation alternatives.

s1: Display an advanced understanding of a variety of algorithms, including linear selection, minimum spanning trees, single source shortest path, Huffman coding, etc, with real-life applications and the resource requirements.
s2: The course also covers more advanced data structures, such as priority queues, B-trees, red-black trees, and AVL trees, and deepens understanding of appropriate algorithmic strategies.

s1: Expertly apply the most effective algorithmic techniques including dynamic programming, greedy policy, and divide-and-conquer, to solve some practical problems.
s2: Apply basic algorithmic analysis to simple algorithms; use big-O notation formally, upper lower, and expected case bounds; use and solve recurrence relations; use appropriate algorithmic approaches to solve problems (brute-force, greedy, divide-and-conquer, recursive backtracking, heuristic, dynamic programming, branch-and-bound).

s1: Define and analyse time and space complexities of algorithms.
s2: Understand, apply, and analyse state and state machines in expressing computations.

s1: Demonstrate experience in the design and implementation of algorithms for practical problems, using languages like C, C++.
s2: Apply fundamental programming concepts for medium scale programs.
